instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: This board is in an S0 state, but <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is at .77v and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> is at .45v. Shorts to ground on both of them. The other VCore rails are at their proper voltages. No obvious signs of liquid damage anywhere on the board. Because there are two separate VCore rails shorted to ground, my gut tells me the CPU is fried. But I'm a bit of a newbie, so I could easily be missing something obvious.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message:
Display is connected???
Any activity on USB??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: Those voltages are fine and would normally indicate a board that has booted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: But the board will POST and turn off before it loads the OS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: Try  another memory module, one slot at a time, it should be PC3-10600.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: Nah it won't be the RAM probably. Are you booting from a known good OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: Yep. If those rails are fine at those voltages, and even with a short to ground, then I’m at a total loss.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
threads.message: You can try the BIOS but that is last ditch effort. Make sure to keep a backup! Also check for a beep without RAM, speaker in the case must be connected.
